purpleculture_pinyin:
xī
knee
колено
rtega_mnemonic:
膝膝RSknee
  • part of the body 月 one puts an object on to varnish 桼
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 桼 indicates the sound; ⺼ (flesh) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
膝盖 [ xī gài ]: knee; (Internet slang) to kneel down (in admiration)
膝下 [ xī xià ]: at the knee (in reference to children); (salutation used in letters to parents or grandparents)
促膝谈心 [ cù xī tán xīn ]: to sit side-by-side and have a heart-to-heart talk (idiom)
卑躬屈膝 [ bēi gōng qū xī ]: to bow and bend the knee (idiom); fawning; bending and scraping to curry favor
奴颜婢膝 [ nú yán bì xī ]: servile and bending the knee (idiom); fawning; bending and scraping to curry favor
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • ⺼ meat, flesh; organic compound
    • 桼 [ qī ] the varnish tree; varnish, lacquer; paint
heisig_chinese_memo: Baron Von Rumpelbrella (Rumpelbrella's uncle) has run out of scams and is reduced to begging on the flesh of his knees in the streets!
heisig_constituent: knee, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, tree, wood, umbrella, grains of rice
koohiiStory1: Before lacquer (#932) was made with water, it was made by draining this body part of fluid: the knee!
koohiiStory2: Back in ancient Japan, people didn´t have knee pads for things like rollerblading and such (what, come on. Ninjas on rollerblades. Ultimate 90s flashback). Instead, they would simply dip their knees in laquer, and wait until it dried (hence the flesh, and the abscence of any drops of water). Unfortunately, this meant that you would have to wait about 30 minutes after deciding to go rollerblade until you could actually do it (took some time to dry) - and removing it was a serious pain.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Under the moon beneath a tree there is a hat filled with water. You stare down into the water and decide to stick your knee in it.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Feel the water splash over your knee as you stick it into this hat. It fits really well, the hat is the perfect size for your knee. Now look up at the moonlight filtering through the tree above.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Suddenly, in your knee, you feel heat and a zap (ひざ)! Your knee is simultaneously burned and electrocuted by the hat water!!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine the heat then the zap going through your knee. It isn't a nice heat, it's a hot heat, then BZZZT zap! Your knee was heat zapped pretty bad.
Ru_Notes: Сравни: 肘 (ひじ、チュウ локоть, рука), 漆 (うるし、シツ лак, глянец)
Ru_Radicals: 个 (китайский счётный суффикс), 月 (месяц), 木 (дерево), 水 (вода)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the body part (⺼) the man in the tree with water (桼) needs is his knee
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Baron Von Rumpelbrella (Rumpelbrella's uncle) has run out of scams and is reduced to begging on the flesh of his knees in the streets!
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " moon ", the sound of "桼", the original meaning is the knee, that is, the front part of the joint connecting the thigh and the calf. " Knee " this as " Xi ", "said the text": "Xi, tibia head Jie also from Jie, Qi sound.." Xu Xuan: "this custom made knee." " Knee " word in the Eastern Han mighty Medical Bamboo has seen . Warring States, Qin and Han unearthed the text " Xi " are from the " Qi " neither from " Shui " only "Wen said," Xiaozhuan from the water, and this regular script from "Wen said," evolved Xiaozhuan (reference Zhoubao Hong).

"Yi Li·Xi Xi": "The robe is long and the lower knee is long." "Zhuangzi·Father of the Fisherman": "The left hand rests on the knee, the right hand holds it for listening." "The Family Instructions of the Yan Clan: Mian Xue" of the Northern Qi Yanzhi: "I sometimes suffer from scabies, and I cannot fist my hands or bend my knees."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " moon ", the sound of "桼", the original meaning is knee.
humanum_full_description:
從「月」，「桼」聲，本義為膝蓋，即大腿與小腿相連的關節前部。「膝」本作「厀」，《說文》：「厀，脛頭卪也。从卩，桼聲。」徐鉉：「今俗作膝。」「膝」字於東漢威武醫簡已見。戰國、秦漢之出土文字「厀」所從之「桼」皆不從「氺」，只有《說文》小篆從水旁，今楷書由《說文》小篆發展而來（參周寶宏）。

　　《儀禮·旣夕》：「袂屬，幅長下膝。」《莊子·漁父》：「左手據膝，右手持頤以聽」。北齊顏之推《顏氏家訓‧勉學》：「時又患疥，手不得拳，膝不得屈。」

膝(ひざ): knee, lap

從「 月 」，「 桼 」聲，本義為膝蓋，即大腿與小腿相連的關節前部。「 膝 」本作「 厀 」，《說文》：「厀，脛頭卪也。从卩，桼聲。」徐鉉：「今俗作膝。」「 膝 」字於東漢威武醫簡已見。戰國、秦漢之出土文字「 厀 」所從之「 桼 」皆不從「 氺 」，只有《說文》小篆從水旁，今楷書由《說文》小篆發展而來（參周寶宏）。 《儀禮·旣夕》：「袂屬，幅長下膝。」《莊子·漁父》：「左手據膝，右手持頤以聽」。北齊顏之推《顏氏家訓‧勉學》：「時又患疥，手不得拳，膝不得屈。」
From the " moon", the sound of " 桼", the original meaning is the knee, that is, the front part of the joint connecting the thigh and the calf. " Knee" this as " Xi", "said the text": "Xi, tibia head Jie also from Jie, Qi sound.." Xu Xuan: "this custom made knee." " Knee" word in the Eastern Han mighty Medical Bamboo has seen . Warring States, Qin and Han unearthed the text " Xi" are from the " Qi" neither from " Shui" only "Wen said," Xiaozhuan from the water, and this regular script from "Wen said," evolved Xiaozhuan (reference Zhoubao Hong). "Yi Li·Xi Xi": "The robe is long and the lower knee is long." "Zhuangzi·Father of the Fisherman": "The left hand rests on the knee, the right hand holds it for listening." "The Family Instructions of the Yan Clan: Mian Xue" of the Northern Qi Yanzhi: "I sometimes suffer from scabies, and I cannot fist my hands or bend my knees."

膝字的基本解释

膝
xī
大腿和小腿相连的关节的前部：膝盖骨（亦称“髌骨”）。护膝。屈膝。膝眼。膝下（子女幼时依偎于父母的膝下，因以“膝下”表示幼年。后用作对父母的敬辞）。奴颜卑膝。

膝字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xī］
［《廣韻》息七切，入質，心。］
“厀1”的今字。亦作“2”。
大腿和小腿相连关节的前部。通称膝盖。

膝字的英文翻译

◎ 膝
knee

膝字的康熙字典解释

【未集下】【肉字部】　膝； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页993第04
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?息七切，音悉。【說文】脛頭卪也。本作厀。【徐曰】今俗作膝。膝，人之節也。【釋名】膝，伸也，可屈伸也。【儀禮·旣夕】袂屬，幅長下膝。　又【韻會】楯名。【揚子·方言】矛骹細如鴈脛者，謂之鶴膝。【唐書·王志愔傳】鶴膝犀渠。【左思·吳都賦】家有鶴膝。　又齧膝，良馬名。【前漢·王褒傳】駕齧膝。【註】孟康曰：良馬，低頭口至膝也。

考證：〔又齒膝，良馬名。【前漢·王褒傳】駕齒膝。〕　謹照原文兩齒字?改齧。
膝字的源字形

膝字的起名意思

暂无。

knee
Basic explanation of words
knee
xī
The front part of the joint that connects the thigh and calf: the kneecap (also known as the "patella"). Knee pads. Bend your knees. Knee eyes. Knee (Children snuggle under the knees of their parents when they are young, because they are "under the knees" to indicate their infancy. Later used as a respect to their parents). Slave face is humble.
knee
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xī］
["Guangyun" breathes seven cuts, enters the quality, and the heart. ]
The present character of "厀1". Also known as "2".
The front part of the joint that connects the thigh and calf. Known as the knee.
knee
English translation of words
◎ knee
knee
knee
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Not set next] [Meat word department] 　 knee; Kangxi strokes: 17; page number: page 993 04
[Guang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun]? Seven cuts of interest, sound information. [Said the text] Shantou also. This is a chop. [Xu Yue] Today's custom is the knee. Knee, the festival of people. 【Release name】Knees can be stretched and flexed. 【Ritual·Xi Xi】The genus of the robe, the width is long and the knee is long.　[Rhyme Club] Last name. 【Yangtze Dialect】Those who have spears as thin as wild shanks are called crane knees. [Tang Shu·Wang Zhiyan Biography] Crane's knees and rhinestones. [Zuo Si·Wu Du Fu] Family has crane knees.　Bite the knee again, the name of a good horse. [Previous Han·Wang Bao Chuan] Driving on the knees. [Note] Meng Kang said: A good horse, bow his head to his knees. Textual research: 〔Also tooth and knee, the name of a good horse. [Previous Han·Wang Bao Chuan] Driving on the knees of teeth. 〕 　 Would you like to change the two teeth according to the original text?
knee
Source glyph
knee
Name meaning
Nothing.
膝
形声字。小篆口表意,其形体像人跪着,以突出膝盖,泰(q)表声。隶、楷书月(肉)表意、泰表声,表示膝是肢体的
一部分。本义是膝盖。
膝盖,大腿与小腿相连处关节的前部:护~「屈~。
~盖 ~下 盘~ 促~谈心 卑躬屈~ 奴颜婢~
第|味
楷
колено
Пиктофонетические символы.
Сяо Чжуанькоу выражает смысл, его форма напоминает человека, стоящего на коленях, чтобы высовывать колени, Тай (q) выражает звук.
Ли, идеограмма Kaishuyue (плоть) и тайская вокализация указывают на то, что колено является частью тела.
Первоначальное значение - колено.
Колено, передняя часть сустава, где соединяются бедро и икра: guard ~ "flex ~".
~ Обложка ~ Концовка ~ Продвигать ~ Говоря и снисходительно ~ Рабыня ~ № | Вкус
Кай
xī
анат. коленный сустав, колени
坐在膝上 сидеть на коленях
水深到膝 вода по колено
屈膝 преклонить колени
Radicals: 月, 木, 水  (moon, tree, water, hat)
Meaning Mnemonic
Under the moon beneath a tree there is a hat filled with water. You stare down into the water and decide to stick your knee in it.
Feel the water splash over your knee as you stick it into this hat. It fits really well, the hat is the perfect size for your knee. Now look up at the moonlight filtering through the tree above.
Reading Mnemonic
Suddenly, in your knee, you feel heat and a zap (ひざ)! Your knee is simultaneously burned and electrocuted by the hat water!!
Imagine the heat then the zap going through your knee. It isn't a nice heat, it's a hot heat, then BZZZT zap! Your knee was heat zapped pretty bad.
